sections.title: Rage Prophet (Class Overview)
sections.description: Overview of the Rage Prophet class including role, alignment, hit die, and starting wealth.

sections.title: Weapon and Armor Proficiency (Rage Prophet)
sections.description: Rage prophets gain no proficiency with any weapon or armor.

sections.title: Spells per Day (Rage Prophet)
sections.description: At indicated levels, a rage prophet gains new spells per day as if gaining a level in a previous divine spellcasting class, but gains no other class benefits.

sections.title: Savage Seer (Rage Prophet)
sections.description: Rage prophet class levels stack with barbarian levels for determining the effect of rage powers, oracle revelations, and oracle curses, but grant no additional abilities.

sections.title: Spirit Guide (Sp) (Rage Prophet)
sections.description: The rage prophet gains a spirit guide that provides guidance spell benefits during rage and grants dancing lights, ghost sound, and mage hand as spell-like abilities once per day.

sections.title: Rage Prophet Mystery (Rage Prophet)
sections.description: At 2nd level and every even level, the rage prophet learns additional spells from a specific list provided by their spirit guide, treating them as oracle spells.

sections.title: Raging Healer (Su) (Rage Prophet)
sections.description: At 2nd level, the rage prophet can cast cure spells on himself while raging without needing to use clarity of mind.

sections.title: Indomitable Caster (Ex) (Rage Prophet)
sections.description: At 3rd level, the rage prophet adds his Constitution bonus to concentration checks.

sections.title: Ragecaster (Su) (Rage Prophet)
sections.description: Starting at 4th level, the rage prophet adds barbarian level to caster level when using moment of clarity, and at 7th level adds Constitution bonus to spell save DCs while raging.

sections.title: Spirit Guardian (Sp) (Rage Prophet)
sections.description: At 5th level, the spirit guide's guidance bonus increases to half class level against certain creature types, and the rage prophet can spend rage rounds to grant ghost touch to weapons and armor.

sections.title: Enduring Rage (Su) (Rage Prophet)
sections.description: At 6th level, the rage prophet can sacrifice spell slots as a free action to extend rage duration by rounds equal to the spell slot level.

sections.title: Raging Spellstrength (Su) (Rage Prophet)
sections.description: At 8th level, the rage prophet can cast spells with personal range on himself while raging without needing clarity of mind.

sections.title: Spirit Warrior (Su) (Rage Prophet)
sections.description: At 9th level, the guidance bonus increases to full class level against certain creature types, and granting ghost touch becomes an immediate action.

sections.title: Greater Rage (Ex) (Rage Prophet)
sections.description: At 10th level, the rage prophet's rage provides +6 morale bonus to Strength and Constitution and +3 morale bonus on Will saves.
